page.title: 04LEIGHTON BROMSWOLD, Cambs.
page.content:
Formerly centre of Leightonstone Hundred, this "village on light hill" has about 75 houses, including former school and chapel, 3 farms within survey area, one pub, no shops - mobile vans weekly, daily bus.
Cricket pitch supports local team with players from several villages.
Church summer fete held annually has stalls whole length of "The Avenue" which is lined with chestnut trees. Dog show held on field owned by local carpenter/builder/painter, who also rings Church bells at special times.
Gatehouse (to Castle which was never built) formerly Vicarage, now restored as family home. Some new houses, but mostly 19th Century, one or two thatched.
